thread.title: InventHelp Inventor Develops Fitness-Equipment Hygiene Accessory (CLT-1118)
thread.title_full: InventHelp Inventor Develops Fitness-Equipment Hygiene Accessory (CLT-1118) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: InventHelp Inventor Develops Fitness-Equipment Hygiene Accessory (CLT-1118)
text:
Based in Pittsburgh, Pa., InventHelp is submitting the PERSONAL BENCHKLOTH (TPB) to companies for their review and potential feedback.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 13, 2015
"After working out in the gym for many years, I got tired of having to spray and wipe the benches off before and after each use," said an inventor from Pinebluff, N.C. "I came up with this accessory as a way to avoid the hassles of spraying and wiping everything down while also keeping the user protected from germs."
He created a prototype for the PERSONAL BENCHKLOTH (TPB) to prevent sweat and germs left behind on equipment from being transferred to the current user. The accessory stops the bench from being soaked by the perspiration of the current user. This leaves the bench surface clean and dry for the next user. The unit eliminates the need to spray and wipe the bench before and after each use. All of this enhances hygiene among fitness enthusiasts who enjoy working out at health clubs and gyms. Furthermore, the device is easy to apply and remove.
The original design was submitted to the Charlotte office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-CLT-1118, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
